p: Vegetal oils that are rich in saturated fatty acids, including some tropical oils (such as palm and coconut oils), are used for formulas in order to increase their energetic value [ 25]. In addition, the inter-esterification process induces favourable effects in infant formula, as the absorption of palmitic acid increases [ 25]. Recently, Sanders has demonstrated that palmitic acid in sn-2 can reduce postprandial lipemia, confirming the joint FAO/WHO study of 2008 [ 8, 26]. A valid nutritional alternative for premature newborns, in the absence of breast milk, is the human milk bank, which has been shown to be a better alternative than formula milk.
